document_data.name: The Adventures of Camber Fosrick
document_data.author: [[Lodevin Parkar]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''The Adventures of Camber Fosrick''''', or '''''Adventures of Camber Fosrick: includes the Adventure of the Battledale Billhook''''', was a collection of six short stories by [[Lodevin Parkar]] of [[Cormyr]] and published in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]]. They featured the popular detective character [[Camber Fosrick]].{{Cite web/The Candlekeep Collection}} It had one volume.
document_data.Description: The book was bound in cheap felt and was rather thin.
document_data.Contents: One story was "The Adventure of the Battledale Billhook", involving a [[billhook]] and [[Battledale]]. In it, to prove a man was a murderer, Fosrick suddenly threw a ball at him, which he caught in his allegedly unusable left hand.
document_data.History: A copy of ''The Adventures of Camber Fosrick'' was mistakenly left at [[Benelaius]]'s cottage in [[Ghars]] by a visiting mage. Benelaius scorned the book, saying the mage had forgotten it "in his dotage" because "Why else would he have read such drivel?" but his servant [[Jasper (servant)|Jasper]] loved it and became a Camber Fosrick fan in [[1367 DR]]. Jasper would attempt to replicate Camber's ball trick by throwing a piece of [[cheese]] at [[Rolf (roofer)|Rolf]] to see if he caught it in his right or left hand. The cheese instead hit him in the head and landed in his [[ale]], but Jasper got his answer when Rolf hit him with his right.
document_data.Availability: A copy of ''The Adventures of Camber Fosrick'' was kept in [[Candlekeep]] around [[1372 DR]].
